abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcome is assessed as
            satisfactory: The project has achieved its development
            objectives. Project sustainability is adjudged as highly
            likely. Both World Bank and Borrower performances are
            adjudged as satisfactory overall. Lessons learned include
            the following: Legal changes aimed at strengthening the tax
            administration's enforcement powers should be
            accompanied by proactive efforts to explain their rationale
            and purpose to taxpayers, representative associations, and
            legislators. Changes in the organizational structure and
            functions of different departments and offices should
            precede IT system development. Senior management positions
            in new organizational structures should be filled as early
            as possible. Implementation teams should be created in
            different functional areas; these teams should act as a link
            between line departments and the project. Off-the-shelf
            application software, though attractive, should be adopted
            only after careful analysis of business requirements and a
            detailed evaluation of available packages. Experts in IT as
            well as tax administration should be used. Individual
            modules of large information systems should be implemented
            as soon as they are ready. A lump sum contract for delivery
            of pre-defined outputs is preferred over a contract based on
            time spent by the contractor in system development.

docna.cdata!:
Jamaica - Tax Administration Reform Project
            : Loan 3758 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

display_title.display_title:
Jamaica - Tax Administration
            Reform Project : Loan 3758 - Loan Agreement - Conformed

abstracts.cdata!:
The Tax Administration Reform Project
            will finance consulting services, training and equipment to:
            i) broaden the tax base by increasing the number of
            registered taxpayers and reducing the number of deductions,
            exemptions and concessions granted by the tax laws; ii)
            strengthen the organization and management of tax
            administration by restructuring the tax departments,
            introducing modern management systems; iii) improve the
            control of tax evasion by strengthening the investigation,
            auditing and assessment capabilities of the tax departments;
            and iv) improve tax collections by introducing new
            collection systems and improving recovery of tax arrears;
            and v) facilitate voluntary compliance by improving the
            equity, fairness and efficiency of the tax system and
            reducing the cost of compliance.
